name: smog
text: A comment left by smog was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tttt2, solobuttons, RedGuy)

name: blueloggy
text: My hand did indeed cup -- to instinctively protect my imagined squeezed hoochie-mama box.

name: boredom_man
text: IT IS A TEST OF SPEED

name: dusty
text:
its Hoochie Coochie, the new game of speed and skill from MB, the makers of Ants in the pants and don't break the ice!

"HAHA, I grabbed your box!"
"kids what are you doing in here?"
(Both)"HOOCHIE COOCHIE!!! HAHAHA LOL"

includes hoochie pants, play gold chains, rub on dragon/wizard tatoo, skoal shirt, and inductive hoochie grab detecting game buzzer.

name: greenkoolayd
text: BRILLIANT!

name: teflontrout
text: You made spit uncracked sunflower seeds on my keyboard.  There's no acronym for that kind of laughter.

name: wazza
text: LSHISUSSOMK?

name: soticoto
text:
Good thing I'm not a hoochie-mama box.
I do not want to be grabbed again.

name: boheeka
text: I know what you're saying, you're saying, "STEVE, WHERE DO YOU FIND TIME TO SQUEEZE HOOCHIE MAMA BOXES?" ...I squeeze them in my mind.

name: afronaut
text: A comment left by afronaut was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, straw, TripperDay, Norsef, divot, madnes, greatwhitehope7, riotdejaneiro, jlynes, chris80x, Thorfinn, mcowgill, JTTuba, tibcoolbreeze, dizneedave, GeyserShitdick, instantkarma, kylemcjuicy, lamelliform, LordHumungus, mortshire, Courtland, farqussus, Professorbun, SkiddyFisk, MortisInvictus, Sargasm, Sleaw, prettyrad, SoupyTwist, DrSkradley, fakedaisies, ravindra108, Setzkin, DavidL, nutmeg, TheSoulBear, HollyBones, Xaxx, Tashara, retinarow, Doc_Rostov, NumberKillinger, nphares, tovarich, Mastronaut, cjfoster, nickb285, Pigs)

name: saint
text: YOU FUCKED UP

name: ariamaki
text:
This is the greatest thing.
Guy makes a terrible, YT quality post, Saint wrecks him.
Guy is 0 for 47, Saint is 6 for 2.
The dichotomy makes me so goddamn happy.

name: johnnylandmine
text: A comment left by johnnylandmine was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, Norsef, madnes, greatwhitehope7, jlynes, Thorfinn, mcowgill, GeyserShitdick, instantkarma, kylemcjuicy, lamelliform, LordHumungus, mortshire, SkiddyFisk, killerlimpet, gardenhead_, nutmeg, Methadone, lastlarf, cjfoster)

name: songbirdspectre
text: i'm a straight lady-sort. and yes. mine did too. DAYUM.

name: apocowarg
text: I was already cupping my bozack when I read panel 8. I raised my non-cupping hand into the air and made a fist after reading the alt text.

name: soticoto
text:
I didn't.
My hand went straight for the sharpened metal meter-rule. That thing is dangerous yo.

name: songbirdspectre
text: good god. good thing you have your trusty weighted companion cube. i don't know how that helps, but it does.

name: soticoto
text:
I'm your only friend.
But I don't want to be a burden to you any longer.

name: songbirdspectre
text: I want to hug my WCC all day long.

name: apocowarg
text: I tried to save you companion cube. I spent hours. I miss you.

name: songbirdspectre
text: *sobbing into handkerchief and organ music*

name: rainwolfj
text: No need to cry, when you die and do to heaven you get to pick a WCC to be your truest friend for the remainder of eternity, it's a beautiful moment.

name: notcool
text: Unless ALL the WCCs ended up in Android Hell.

name: afronaut
text: A comment left by afronaut was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, straw, silver_lake, LordHumungus, mortshire, Courtland, DavidL, cathaoir, nutmeg, SeanBad, HollyBones, anitrophaeron, nphares, tovarich, J-Man, Mastronaut, cjfoster)

name: mugi
text: Why all the lames; this guy is obviously not talking about the strip.

name: johnnylandmine
text: you are my only friend mugi

name: methadone
text: lets face it guys, the bailiffs of witchclyde will never outshine trials of honor

name: ford
text: It's honour

name: spinynorman
text:
You know Pat buys all the tote bags, then turns it up real loud and opens the windows so people know he's watching Bailiffs of Witchclyde on PBS.

PBS

name: wargasmic
text: Once Pat realized that a true putt-putt loving pair's contiguous US RV tour was dependent upon his support, he put The Bailiffs on the back burner. That's what friends do.

name: norrin
text: Even jerk-wad friends can rise to the occassion, given the right circumstances.

name: farqussus
text: The right circumstances: being massaged by vaguely racist diatribes about anti-social miscreants. Ray knows Pat. Hew knows him.

name: farqussus
text: FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFUCK

name: mikeleffel2
text: Lordy that hilarious Ray-speak! Hee Hee!

name: sherief
text: It just about gave me the vapors!

name: fielding
text: Oh, hee hee hee!  Hee hee!  Oh, hee hee hee!

name: professorhazard
text: DAMN IT! Should have scrolled down before posting.

name: professorhazard
text:
Oh, hee hee!

Hee hee hee!

Oh, hee hee hee!

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Oh, haw haw!
Haw haw haw!
Oh, haw haw haw!

name: davidl
text: It makes sense that Ray would make this important phone call without waiting to dry off from the shower/hot tub/Olympic-sized swimming pool that he was apparently just in. I guess that kind of multitasking is why he's the cat who gets things done.

name: twotonturkey
text: There is a scene in the director's cut of The Warriors when they are attacked by a gang of metal putter wielding street toughs.

name: phoenixultima
text: The guys with the baseball bats would have kicked their asses.

name: johnmatrix
text: I'm playing The Warriors game right now, the first time I read this comment. Very strange.

name: foea
text: They had face paint, nobody was scared of those guys.

name: ford
text: That face paint was badass.  Retract dude, retract!

name: shmuckeles
text: ray makes me sad because my language is so sparse. my language is spare because noone can understand me when it is colourful and lively. that is my sadness.

name: someone3
text: i know your pain...

name: rotating-dog
text: I once tried to take a driver to the mini golf course. The plan was not successful, it is impossible to walk with a smuggled driver in your shirt.

name: fielding
text: Shirt ? You fool!

name: zaratustra
text: Is that a five-iron in your pants or are you just happy to see me?

name: woodenteeth
text:
Actually, it's a pitching wedge...

but yes, I do have an erection.

name: centipede_damascus
text: This strip is from a future where minigolf courses are a lot more pleasant place to be than they are today.

name: rogergs
text: Breast Men can present their Chain of Behavior ID card for a complementary apple martini behind the caretaker's shack.

name: le_chien_manquee
text: i couldn't last 3 holes in the company of a hoochie mama showing her camel toe without squeezing it.  it's impossible!

name: mcwee
text: What's important is that the box-squeezing was qualified.  The problem is not squeezing a hootchie's box, but doing so *too close to a family.*  The minimum distance is 13 feet with no clear line of sight to the family.

name: qwerty
text: A comment left by qwerty was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by kylank, farqussus, Xaxx, grayfox)

name: mr_pete
text: As a lad growing up Tennessee, I would go down to the putt-putt on Friday night, and watch the Pomade Rockabillies tune their muscle cars and polish the chrome on their putters.

name: skiddyfisk
text: Pat agreeing with anyone on any topic is a far more shocking plot twist than spinning a lawn art war into an engagement arc.

name: professorriffs
text: My drummer got a DWI (Driving While Intoxicated) at 2 in the morning, wearing a tux and driving a golf cart.  I wonder if there's a Chain of Driving Golf Cart cards.....

name: dukieshane
text: A comment left by dukieshane was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by katal, shammack, pulkbaby)

name: augeno13
text: How, indeed.  I don't think I've seen a new strip since assetbar came in that was below a 4.

name: augeno13
text:
and of course, I immediately flip back and Friday's has dropped below a 4. I think some guy's sitting up late cleaning out browser cookies to refresh and hit 1 over and over.

That's right Jim Davis. I'm onto you.

name: tetsujin
text: A comment left by tetsujin was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, Vondicus, fosters, anitrophaeron, Mastronaut, gkiyo)

name: silver_lake
text: If you think "squeezin' a hoochie mama's box through the front of her pants" isn't worth the two seconds it took to read it, then what strips DO you like?

name: tetsujin
text: A comment left by tetsujin was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, HonestTom, kazad, fosters, anitrophaeron, Mastronaut)

name: silver_lake
text: WARNING guy with Go-Bots avatar and Japanesey name acting superior on webcomics messageboard WARNING

name: plezure
text: This strip's dialog is out of control.

name: phthoggos
text: A comment left by phthoggos was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by DR_MANFLESH_DESIRES_ANAL_PLAY_IMMEDIATELY, katal, obvious)

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I love the image of a "sniffle-top cholo". A "sniffle-top" anything is good by me.

name: rolotonybrowntown
text: i prefer a titleist when trying to ruin a family's day

name: lokier
text: A comment left by lokier was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, beafdog, Mastronaut)

name: tehdiplomat
text: You had me at doo-wop guidos. I can just picture the wife beaters and flipped collars.

name: seanbad
text: Collared wife-beater shirts?

name: tekende
text: Leather jackets over wife-beaters...?

name: projectyl
text:
"A television station with so smug it has 'QED' in its name is a perfect fit for Pat." That was going to be my post a minute or two ago, back when I thought it was an invention of the author.

Then I Googled it. KQED actually exists, and is in California . Which just makes it doubly beautiful.

name: tellumo
text: And it's in the Bay Area, on channel 9, a PBS station, and the QED actually does stand for what you think it does .

name: jrpigman
text: KQED is the channel that taught me from a very young age that if Martin Yan was capable of cooking, I also was by inferred proxy.

name: jackparsons
text: KQED brought me Monty Python and "I, Claudius" which taught me that Englishmen in togas were damn cool.

name: cuneocapo
text: Pat being positive towards anything besides Steve's party just boggles my mind in so many ways.

name: paperboy_2000
text: This gets a '5' for footnotes. Reference: The Proliferation of Hooliganism, Vandalism, and Other Low Behavior in North American Mini-Golf , Chapter 5, Sword, Spear, and Phallus: The Many Uses of the Putter

name: son_of_selleck
text: I, too, was a hickety-hi dip wigger. alas, I never found my babysitter Chicacita (she was AWOL)

name: andreas52
text: i... there is nothing i dont like about this strip.  i know its been discussed but, seriously, dude used the word box.  then he combined it with squeezin.  its like the chick's business is an accordian and he the monkey ownin guido who plays it.  man i am still giggled at that.  nuts to those that dont like it.  now place a coin in my hat.

name: phy
text: You should listen to The Who.

name: mastronaut
text:
Mama's got a squeeze-box
Daddy doesn't sleep at night.

name: kateorman
text: A comment left by kateorman was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ColonelColostomy, grayestnova, DonCaballero, tpederson, Fielding, SeanBad, anitrophaeron, beafdog, Audhumla, Mastronaut)

name: fielding
text: No, I'm afraid I'm going to have to inform you that it was entirely necessary. Coarse , you know, but it's at least a step in the right direction.

name: deancain29
text: As an avid mini-golfer, I wholeheartley agree!

name: professorhazard
text: This fresh-out-of-the-bath phone call from Ray is so fresh, he is still dripping in panels 3 and 4.

name: dueledge
text: muffin top: the fat hanging over the top of tight jeans. I came across this term shortly before reading this strip, which was a bit weird.

name: morbo
text: Beef lost out, wasn't it originally a 50 state tour?

name: phy
text: It was, but they figured out Hawaii would be problematic and Rhode Island's too small to fit both an RV and a minigolf course at the same time.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Philippe: I was wrong about celebrities!

name: highpitch_83
text: Ray brings the jive STRONG

name: diggydow
text: This one is so underrated.

name: tekende
text: If someone called me and asked me to chip in $600 toward a friend's wedding gift, I would laugh in his/her face. Over the phone. And then I would get in my car, drive to the caller's residence, and laugh some more.

name: tellumo
text: Isn't a sawbuck $10, making the total cost $60?

name: tekende
text: Oh, is it? Well, that's much more reasonable.

name: saulbellow
text: Either way you'd be lookin' at a six hundo.

name: zapatos
text: I love Ray's crazy racist slang.

name: smallberries
text: Baliffs of Witchclyde? Gotta be the best awful boring British mini-series ever not produced. Pat's irritation at the call is priceless! I used to wait until X Files was on to call my pal Bob and his wife as they were much too fond of it, then talk about pressing topics like navel lint or crop rotation.
